verses.verse: Welcome him who is weak in the faith, but not for a judgmental confrontation.
For one believes that he can eat anything, another, who is weak [in faith], eats herbs.
Don't let him who [feels free] to eat [anything] despise him who doesn't, and don't let him who doesn't [feel free] to eat [some things], judge the other, for God has welcomed him.
Who are you to judge another man's servant? He is approved or condemned by his own master. Yes, he will stand approved, for God is able to make him stand.
Someone decides that one day is more important than another; someone else decides that every day [is alike]. Each one must be fully convinced in his mind.

The one who considers one day [more important] considers [it] for the Lord's [honor], and the one who doesn't consider one day [more important] considers [that] for the Lord. He who [feels free] to eat [all foods], eats for the Lord's [honor], because he gives thanks to God. He who doesn't [feel free] to eat [some things] does that for the Lord's [honor] and gives God thanks.
None of us lives for our self, and no one dies for himself.
For if we live, we live for the Lord, and if we die, we die for the Lord. Therefore whether we live or die, we are the Lord's,
for this reason Christ died, regained life, and rose again, so that he would rule over both the dead and living.
So why do you judge your brother, or why do you despise your brother? For we will all stand before the judgment seat of Christ.
For it is written, "As I live," says the Lord, "every knee will bow to me, and every tongue will confess to God."
So then every one of us will give an account of himself to God.
Therefore we can't condemn one another anymore, instead condemn this: let no one put a stumbling block or offending thing in [his] brother's way.
I know and am persuaded by the Lord Jesus that nothing [is] unclean in itself, but to him who considers something unclean, then to him, [it is] unclean.
If your brother's feelings are hurt because of your food, you are not walking in love. Do not destroy him, for whom Christ died, with your food.
So then don't let your good be evil spoken of,
for the kingdom of God is not food and drink but righteousness, peace, and joy in the Holy Spirit.
He who serves Christ in these things [is] well pleasing to God and approved by men.
Therefore let us follow things that result in peace and things that can build up each another.
Don't tear down the work of God on account of food. It's true that everything is pure but even so [it is] wrong for that man who eats, who feels he is doing wrong.
It would be better not to eat flesh or drink wine or [anything] that would cause your brother to stumble, be offended, or be weakened [in the faith].
Do you have faith? Have it for yourself in God's sight. Happy is the one who doesn't condemn himself in what he has approved.
The one who doubts is condemned if he eats, because [it is] not with faith, for whatever [is] not of faith is sin.
